title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This is an interview format introducing the team at Uniurb, led by Fabio Giglietto, working on the vera.ai project. It discusses challenges and trends in disinformation analysis, particularly concerning AI language models. Giglietto expresses concerns about the exploitation of media ecosystem vulnerabilities to manipulate public opinion.
description: This is an interview with the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team, led by Fabio Giglietto, regarding their work on the vera.ai project, focusing on disinformation analysis and the challenges posed by AI language models.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: This page includes a discussion with Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, about his work on mis- and disinformation, particularly concerning coordinated inauthentic behavior. He discusses his research on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy and how actors adapt to social media platform crackdowns.
description: A podcast discussion with Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, about his research on mis- and disinformation, particularly concerning coordinated inauthentic behavior and COVID-19 disinformation in Italy. He also discusses how actors adapt to social media platform crackdowns.

title: All Articles – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: This page mentions a video recording of a talk by Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino, given in June 2023 at the Queensland University of Technology (QUT) about using OpenAI models to identify the most salient topics circulated via Facebook links in the run-up to the Italian general elections. It also links to the interview with his team as part of the vera.ai project.
description: The page mentions a talk by Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino about using OpenAI models to identify salient topics on Facebook related to the Italian elections, and links to an interview with his team on the vera.ai project.

title: SOS! ORA L’ALGORITMO PUNTA SUI ‘COMPLOTTISTI’: “INTERVENIRE SUBITO!” - ByoBlu
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
L'Europa assolda Urbino contro le fake-news - Il Resto del Carlino
snippet: This article reports on the European Union investing 7 million euros in the Vera.ai project, which aims to combat disinformation. A team coordinated by Fabio Giglietto, a professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino, will receive 400,000 euros as a partner in the project. Giglietto discusses the urgency of addressing disinformation to protect the democratic system and mentions the exploitation of uncertainty during the pandemic to spread skepticism and fear.
description: This article discusses the European Union's Vera.ai project aimed at combating disinformation, in which Fabio Giglietto, Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino, is participating with his research team.
